articles.original_title: Russia threatens Europe's cybersecurity - Prime Minister makes strategic decision
articles.optimized_title: Poland Bolsters TVN, Polsat Cybersecurity Amid Russian Threats
articles.description: Prime Minister Donald Tusk met with Estonian Prime Minister Kristen Michal in Warsaw. The talks focused on the security of Poland and Estonia, assistance to Ukraine, and cooperation in the region and within NATO. The politicians paid special attention to the need to ensure cybersecurity in Europe. That is why Donald Tusk decided that TVN and Polsat television stations will be placed on the list of strategic companies that are subject to special protection, e.g. against aggressive takeovers.

articles.original_title: Orlen and banks dragged WIG20 down. The atmosphere around the Polish champion is getting thicker, and the share price is getting lower
articles.optimized_title: Orlen and Banks Tumble, WIG20 Sinks as Polish Champ's Share Price Drops
articles.description: The WIG20's shortness of breath has become a fact, which is why the index ended Wednesday's session with a clear sell-off, which is primarily due to the declines in the largest banks and Orlen. Shareholders are slowly losing patience with emerging doubts about the company's largest investment projects. Gaming stocks were under pressure again. In turn, the Rafako rally seems to have definitely come to an end in the face of new information.

articles.original_title: Tusk: TVN and Polsat will be on the list of strategic companies. Without the government's consent, it will not be possible to take over these companies
articles.optimized_title: TVN, Polsat on Strategic List: No Takeovers Without Gov't Approval
articles.description: TVN and Polsat television stations will be placed on the list of strategic companies that are subject to protection, e.g. against aggressive and dangerous (from the point of view of state interests) takeovers, Prime Minister Donald Tusk announced on Wednesday.

articles.original_title: US inflation up. No negative surprises, though
articles.optimized_title: US Inflation Up, Meets Forecasts with No Surprises
articles.description: November CPI inflation in the US turned out to be in line with economists’ forecasts. The increase in the consumer price index took place while maintaining the current core inflation, which was anchored at an elevated level.

articles.original_title: NBP bought the most gold among central banks this year
articles.optimized_title: **Poland's NBP Tops Gold Purchases Among Central Banks This Year**
articles.description: By the end of September, the National Bank of Poland had purchased 42 tons of gold to increase its currency reserves, the largest amount among central banks in the world this year, the think tank OMFIF reported, citing data from the World Gold Council.

articles.original_title: LOT is preparing for a big purchase. Up to 84 new jets in the game
articles.optimized_title: LOT Polish Airlines to Buy Up to 84 New Jets for Regional Routes
articles.description: LOT Polish Airlines should select a supplier of new aircraft for regional routes in the first quarter of 2025, according to Wednesday's statement by Deputy Minister of Infrastructure Maciej Lasek.

articles.original_title: Will More Ballistic Missiles Fall on Ukraine? US Intelligence: Kremlin Wants to Intimidate the West and Ukraine
articles.optimized_title: US Intel: Russia to Launch More Missiles at Ukraine to Intimidate West
articles.description: American intelligence believes that Russia may again fire the Oreshnik ballistic missile towards Ukraine in the coming days, AP reported, citing a US administration official. Washington believes that such actions by the Kremlin are a way to intimidate Ukraine.

articles.original_title: Polish Gaming Horror Charts: Several Years of Growth Eradicated in Three Months
articles.optimized_title: Polish Gaming Stocks Plummet: 11 Bit Studios Leads Sector Decline
articles.description: The 11 bit studios sell-off has brought the stock to its lowest level since March 2018. This is not the only major gaming company on the WSE that has been hitting multi-year lows in recent weeks. We show you charts of horrors for companies from the industry listed on the WSE. Although 95% of WIG-Gry companies are in the red this year, the entire index is recording some of the highest sectoral rates of return.

articles.original_title: Beer rationing? Guinness keeps the English waiting
articles.optimized_title: Guinness Supply Dwindles: Liverpool Pubs Ration Beer for Holidays
articles.description: An Irish pub in Liverpool uses an average of 12 50-litre barrels a week. It has now received just half of its order. Across England, there are shortages of the Irish drink. Some bars have been without it since last Friday. Distributors say they are saving up to make it through Christmas and New Year's Eve, especially since the warehouses were emptied during the rugby games.

articles.original_title: Auto giant winds down part of business: $10 billion down the drain
articles.optimized_title: GM Halts Robotaxi Project: $10B Loss, Autonomous Focus Shifts to Personal Vehicles
articles.description: General Motors said it would stop funding and end development of a robotaxi at Cruise. The project had cost $10 billion, but GM said it would now focus on developing autonomous systems for use in personal vehicles.

articles.original_title: LPP Group posted PLN 579 million in net profit in Q3, compared to the consensus of PLN 634.6 million
articles.optimized_title: LPP Group's Q3 Net Profit Misses Expectations at PLN 579M
articles.description: The LPP Group had PLN 579 million of net profit of the parent company in the third quarter of the 2024/25 financial year, compared to PLN 576 million a year ago, the company reported in a report. Analysts surveyed by PAP Biznes expected PLN 634.6 million of profit.

articles.original_title: Orlen stops Olefina III investment. It was supposed to be PLN 8 billion, but it is over PLN 50 billion
articles.optimized_title: Orlen Halts Olefin III, Redirects PLN 8B to New Chemistry Project
articles.description: The Orlen Management Board has decided to stop the Olefiny III project, the concern informed in a statement. From now on, the work will be carried out as part of the New Chemistry project, in a way that allows for the rationalization of the necessary expenditures.

articles.original_title: EPP MEPs call on the EC to withdraw the ban on combustion engines from 2035
articles.optimized_title: EPP MEPs Urge EC to Reverse 2035 Ban on Combustion Cars
articles.description: The European People's Party Group in the European Parliament - which includes PO and PSL - called on the EC on Wednesday to withdraw the ban on the sale of cars with combustion engines from 2035. We demand a return to technological neutrality, MEP Jens Gieseke announced at a press conference in Brussels.

articles.original_title: Deputy head of the European Commission: In exceptional situations, member states may suspend the right to asylum
articles.optimized_title: EU Vice-President: Temporary Asylum Suspension Allowed in Extreme Circumstances
articles.description: The European Commission's vice-president for security and democracy, Henna Virkkunen, announced on Wednesday that EU countries, defending the security of the Union's borders, can take special measures, such as suspending the right to asylum. These measures must be exceptional and introduced temporarily, she stressed.

articles.original_title: Russia's 'shadow fleet' of oil transporters targeted, Poland announces new sanctions package
articles.optimized_title: Poland Targets Russia's 'Shadow Fleet' with New Sanctions Package
articles.description: Finance Minister Andrzej Domański said in Brussels that Poland will seek to impose further sanctions on Russia, including the 16th package aimed at illegal trade in Russian oil.

articles.original_title: The Supreme Court’s Extraordinary Control Chamber upheld PiS’s complaint against the National Electoral Commission’s decision to reject the 2023 election report.
articles.optimized_title: Supreme Court Upholds PiS Complaint Against 2023 Election Report Rejection
articles.description: The Supreme Court's Chamber of Extraordinary Control and Public Affairs has upheld PiS's complaint against the decision of the National Electoral Commission to reject the report of that party's committee for the 2023 elections, Supreme Court spokesman Aleksander Stępkowski said on Wednesday.

articles.original_title: Investigation against former Lotos CEO dismissed. He allegedly exposed the company to losses
articles.optimized_title: Prosecutors Drop Case Against Ex-Lotos CEO Over Alleged Losses
articles.description: The District Prosecutor's Office in Gdańsk has discontinued the investigation into, among others, the former CEO of Grupa Lotos, Paweł Olechnowicz, who was suspected of causing significant financial damage to the company in 2011, the spokesman said on Wednesday.

articles.original_title: Another government approach to the wind farm bill. It may come out of the climate ministry next week
articles.optimized_title: Climate Ministry to Advance Wind Farm Bill Next Week
articles.description: The Ministry of Climate and Environment will be ready to send the draft law liberalizing distance requirements for onshore wind farms to the next stage outside the ministry next week, Minister of Climate and Environment Paulina Hennig-Kloska informed journalists.

articles.original_title: Will the US abolish daylight saving time? The new Trump administration wants it
articles.optimized_title: Trump's Advisers Push to Abolish Daylight Saving Time
articles.description: The US "government efficiency" advisers in the new Donald Trump administration, Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy, are in favor of completely abolishing daylight saving time across the country, the Washington Post reported on Tuesday. It recalled that the US Senate presented a plan in 2022 to make daylight saving time effective year-round.

articles.original_title: Polish Nuclear Power Plant. First Reactor Launch Date Is Here
articles.optimized_title: Poland's First Nuclear Power Plant: Reactor Launch Set for 2036
articles.description: The update of the Polish Nuclear Power Program envisages the beginning of commercial operation of the first unit of the first Polish nuclear power plant in 2036, announced on Wednesday the government's plenipotentiary for strategic energy infrastructure, Wojciech Wrochna.

articles.original_title: Media pluralism is the foundation of democracy." US ambassador to Poland speaks out after TVN decision
articles.optimized_title: US Ambassador: Media Pluralism Crucial for Democracy Amid Security Threats
articles.description: Media pluralism is the foundation of democracy. In the face of global challenges related to foreign, harmful interference, it is important for governments to take action to protect strategic infrastructure from potential threats to national security, said U.S. Ambassador to Poland Mark Brzezinski.

articles.original_title: Further sanctions against Russia. EU countries have adopted the 15th package
articles.optimized_title: EU Adopts 15th Package of Sanctions Against Russia
articles.description: Ambassadors of member states to the EU have adopted the 15th package of sanctions against Russia, an EU source told journalists in Brussels. To enter into force, it must still be supported by foreign ministers at the EU Council meeting on Monday.

articles.original_title: TV Republika presenter becomes Karol Nawrocki's spokesperson
articles.optimized_title: TV Republika's Emilia Wierzbicki Becomes Karol Nawrocki's Spokesperson
articles.description: Emilia Wierzbicki, associated with Telewizja Republika, has become the spokeswoman for the PiS-supported presidential candidate Karol Nawrocki. The IPN president introduced her on Wednesday during a meeting with residents of Tomaszów Mazowiecki in the Łódź province.

articles.original_title: Ukraine's Finance Minister: We have the means to wage war until mid-2025
articles.optimized_title: Ukraine's Finance Minister: We Can Fight Until Mid-2025
articles.description: We have enough funds and weapons to resist Russian troops at least until the middle of next year, Ukrainian Finance Minister Serhiy Marchenko said in an interview with Spanish daily El Pais on Wednesday.

articles.original_title: Farmers skeptical about Mercosur deal. Brazilian beef with hormones "on the fork" of EU officials
articles.optimized_title: EU Farmers Skeptical Over Mercosur Deal: Hormone-Free Brazilian Beef in Question
articles.description: The European Commission published some of the documents that make up the free trade agreement between the EU and Mercosur countries on Wednesday. The agreement includes a system that will ensure that beef imported to the EU from Brazil was produced without the use of hormones banned in the EU, the EC assured.

articles.original_title: Klimczak: Start of construction of the Warsaw bypass one of the biggest challenges for the Ministry of Infrastructure
articles.optimized_title: Minister Klimczak: Warsaw Bypass Construction Among Major Challenges for Infrastructure Ministry
articles.description: The commencement of construction of the Warsaw agglomeration bypass or the expansion of the railway network are the greatest challenges facing the Ministry of Infrastructure, said the head of the ministry, Dariusz Klimczak, on Wednesday during a conference summarizing the ministry's year of work.

articles.original_title: Half a year with in vitro reimbursement in Poland. "Almost 7 thousand pregnancies, 20 thousand couples in the procedure
articles.optimized_title: In Vitro Reimbursement in Poland: 6,752 Pregnancies, 20,000 Couples Treated
articles.description: Thanks to the in vitro reimbursement program, 6,752 women are currently pregnant, and 20,000 couples have qualified for infertility treatment using this method, said Izabela Leszczyna, the Minister of Health, on Wednesday. After six months of the program, Poland has advanced from 42nd to 19th place in the European Infertility Treatment Atlas.

articles.original_title: Record coffee prices. Wholesale prices have gone up by 80 percent, and that's not the end of the increases
articles.optimized_title: Coffee Prices Soar: Wholesale Costs Up 80% in 2024
articles.description: On Tuesday, half a kilogram of Arabica was priced at $3.44 on international commodity markets. Robusta beans are also seeing similar growth in purchase costs. This means that coffee prices have risen by over 80% in 2024 alone. This, in turn, will translate into retail prices. Will coffee become a luxury alongside butter?

articles.original_title: President of the National Health Fund: There is no guarantee that we will pay for overperformance [INTERVIEW]
articles.optimized_title: **National Health Fund Chief: No Guarantee for Overperformance Payments**
articles.description: - Politics has its own rules, and we, as a public institution, must manage money rationally - says Filip Nowak, president of the National Health Fund, in an interview for Dziennik Gazeta Prawna.

articles.original_title: Duda and Tusk will go to Trump together [OPINION]
articles.optimized_title: Duda and Tusk to Meet Trump: Polish Security Policy Unchanged
articles.description: The most important area of ​​Polish policy – ​​security – was largely a continuation of what the United Right had started last year. Neither the modernization of the army, the protection of the border with Belarus, nor relations with Ukraine were subject to revision. No significant arms contracts were terminated. The South Korean direction is continued.

articles.original_title: Hazardous waste clean-up. Plans include support from earmarked reserve
articles.optimized_title: Ministry to Tackle Hazardous Waste Cleanup with Earmarked Funds
articles.description: In January, the Ministry of Climate will begin work on designating the first hazardous waste for removal.

articles.original_title: PiS complaint upheld. Supreme Court decision
articles.optimized_title: Supreme Court Upholds PiS Complaint Against Election Ruling
articles.description: The Supreme Court’s Chamber of Extraordinary Control has decided to uphold the complaint filed by Law and Justice against the National Electoral Commission’s decision to reject the report of the party’s electoral committee on the 2023 parliamentary elections.

articles.original_title: TVN and Polsat as strategic companies. The internet is in a frenzy. "A new Bierut decree?", "an uneducated gang", "caring for the good of Poland
articles.optimized_title: Tusk Declares TVN, Polsat Strategic; Spark Debate
articles.description: Donald Tusk announced today that TVN and Polsat will be placed on the list of strategic companies that are subject to protection against, for example, takeovers that are dangerous from the point of view of the interests of the Polish state. This news divided politicians and experts. Dr. Michał Sopiński asked on the X service whether we are dealing with a new Bierut decree.

articles.original_title: A Difficult Start to Adulthood: Young Poles at Risk of Poverty
articles.optimized_title: Poland's Young Adults: Struggling with Poverty and Exclusion
articles.description: The group most affected by poverty and social exclusion in Poland are currently the so-called "young adults". Experts point out the need for systemic support for those most in need.

articles.original_title: TVN and Polsat will be on the list of strategic companies. Tusk decided
articles.optimized_title: **"TVN and Polsat Named Strategic Companies by Tusk"**
articles.description: TVN and Polsat will be placed on the list of strategic companies that are subject to protection, e.g. against aggressive and dangerous, from the point of view of state interests, takeovers. Donald Tusk: Without the consent of the Polish government, it will not be possible to take over or buy these companies.

articles.original_title: Concluding an Online Contract: What You Need to Know to Avoid Being Scammed!
articles.optimized_title: Master Online Contracts: Stay Safe from Scams
articles.description: Nowadays, more and more transactions are made online. Online shopping, digital services, subscriptions or reservations - all of this has become part of our everyday life. However, concluding a contract online involves a certain risk. In order not to be fooled, it is worth knowing the legal basis and rules that govern contracts concluded online.

articles.original_title: Unconscious mistakes in your will can cost your loved ones a fortune! Find out what to avoid
articles.optimized_title: Avoid Costly Will Mistakes: Protect Your Loved Ones' Inheritance
articles.description: A will is a key document in the inheritance process, allowing each person to decide independently how to divide their estate after death. Unfortunately, even minor formal errors or lack of knowledge of the rules of inheritance can lead to conflicts between heirs, invalidation of the will, and even complicated legal proceedings. In this article, we present the most common mistakes made when preparing wills and practical tips on how to avoid them.

articles.original_title: Who is entitled to the widow's pension? ZUS is responsible
articles.optimized_title: Claiming Widow's Pension: ZUS Outlines Eligibility Criteria
articles.description: The Social Insurance Institution has issued a statement in which it presents the conditions that must be met in order to receive the so-called widow's pension. For this purpose, the potential beneficiary can complete a questionnaire available on the ZUS website. Who can benefit from combining the payment of a family pension with another benefit? We answer.

articles.original_title: 4,500 PLN tax refund for everyone. Check what you need to do
articles.optimized_title: Boost Your Tax Refund: Claim Up to 4,500 PLN by Saving for Retirement
articles.description: It is possible to get a tax refund of up to PLN 4,500. Simply start saving for retirement under tax relief to take advantage of the available benefits. With simple actions, you can significantly increase your tax refund in next year's settlement.

articles.original_title: Gift Tax? Check when you can get a summons from the tax office!
articles.optimized_title: Gift Tax Alert: When to Report & Avoid Summons
articles.description: Receiving gifts is a joyful moment, but in some cases it may involve the need to settle tax formalities. The Polish tax system requires that gifts or donations received be reported to the tax office if their value exceeds certain thresholds. Failure to do so may result in a summons from the tax office or even penalties. Check when gift tax is required and how to avoid problems with the tax office.

articles.original_title: Orlen stops construction of Olefin. This will save from loss of PLN 15 billion
articles.optimized_title: Orlen Halts Olefina III Project, Saves PLN 15 Billion
articles.description: Orlen's board announced today that it has halted the Olefina III investment due to excessively high costs. The company argues that this will protect it from a loss of approximately PLN 15 billion. The company's management announced that it has informed the prosecutor's office about the irregularities.

articles.original_title: There is a draft of changes to the definition of mobbing ready. What could change?
articles.optimized_title: Poland Set to Redefine Mobbing: Key Changes Revealed
articles.description: The persistent harassment of an employee is to be a fundamental feature of the definition of mobbing, declares the Ministry of Family, Labor and Social Policy. In its opinion, this is the most important assumption of the bill, which was created in this ministry and is currently waiting to be entered into the list of legislative works of the government. It is the implementation of the announcement made by the Minister of Labor Agnieszka Dziemianowicz-Bąk in November this year regarding the clarif

articles.original_title: Lunch card premium relief. Employee will have to take a photo of the receipt
articles.optimized_title: Photo Receipt Required for Lunch Card Premium Relief
articles.description: This results from the interpretation of the ZUS branch in Gdańsk of 3 December 2024 (DI/100000/43/1101/2024). This is only the first light at the end of the tunnel, because so far, since 1 September 2023, since workplaces have had the right to finance reduced lunches for employees using prepaid cards made available to them, all applications for interpretations have been rejected.

articles.original_title: ORLEN withdraws from investment in Olefins III. A decision that will save billions
articles.optimized_title: ORLEN Halts Olefins III Investment, Saving Billions
articles.description: ORLEN has made a strategic decision to stop the Olefin III project, which will allow the company to avoid a loss of around PLN 15 billion. This is the result of a thorough analysis of costs and irregularities in the implementation of the investment, which were reported to the prosecutor's office.

articles.original_title: If the increase in duties is not temporary, no special allowance may be granted for it.
articles.optimized_title: City Hall Employee's Car Allowance Challenged: Permanent Duties or Periodic Perks?
articles.description: Can a special allowance be granted to a city hall employee who, in addition to performing tasks specified in their scope of duties, also regularly drives a company car while performing other tasks for the office? The regional audit chamber questioned the allowance that we granted to the employee for a period of one year. It assessed that the duties performed by him were permanent, not periodic. Is such an expense really illegal?

articles.original_title: The commune, like a bank, must include provisions on security in loan agreements.
articles.optimized_title: Mayor Accused: Missing Security Provisions in Loan Agreements
articles.description: The regional audit chamber accused the mayor of failing to use provisions on securing receivables in loan agreements, e.g. on guarantees or bills of exchange. The mayor believes that the chamber's allegations are unfounded due to the principle of freedom of contract. Are we really violating the law?

articles.original_title: More time for Prevention 40 plus. The program is to be extended until the end of 2025
articles.optimized_title: **Boosting Prevention: Health Checks for Over-40s Extended to 2025**
articles.description: The preventive examination program for people over 40 should be extended until the end of next year, and not only until April 2025. This is according to the comments submitted to the draft amendment to the regulation being developed by the Ministry of Health (MZ).

articles.original_title: Nationalization Russian Style: Accuse, Imprison, Seize
articles.optimized_title: Russia's War-Driven Nationalization: Accusations, Arrests, Seizures
articles.description: Never before in modern Russian history has the state seized so much private property as in the third year of the Putin-induced war. The Kremlin calls it “nationalization.” In reality, it is the plunder of private assets.

articles.original_title: Russia-Ukraine War. Day 1022
articles.optimized_title: Russia-Ukraine War: Day 1022, Missile & Drone Attacks Escalate
articles.description: On February 24, 2022, Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine. On the night of December 10-11, Ukrainians launched a missile attack on an industrial plant in the Rostov region. In turn, Ukrainian drones attacked a refinery in the Bryansk region.

articles.original_title: Baseball player to earn highest salary in history: Contract that dwarfed all others
articles.optimized_title: Juan Soto Secures Record-Breaking $765M, 15-Year Contract
articles.description: Juan Soto has always negotiated high and finally got the biggest contract in sports history. The Dominican baseball player will earn $765 million in 15 years.
